info.game_comments:
2001 Celebrity Jeopardy! game 2.
From the Las Vegas Hilton.

(John Lauderdale: "This used to be Elvis Presley's dressing room here at the Hilton; now it belongs to Alex Trebek.  Alex, 30 seconds!")
(Alex: [dressed in an Elvis outfit] "Thank You, John, Thank You!  Yeah!")

(1, 1).clue: Ken Blackburn, seen here, has set a world record for time aloft for one of these, & he's written books on them

(2, 1).clue: You'll feel like Santa when you ride a sleigh pulled by these animals at the Assiniboine Park Zoo in Winnipeg

(3, 1).clue: Cigars from this island 90 miles south of Florida are treasured by some as the best in the world

(4, 1).clue: What Little Miss Muffet was eating while she sat on her tuffet

(5, 1).clue: The 1976 concert film "The Song Remains the Same" starred this "Stairway to Heaven" group

(6, 1).clue: Headquartered in Stamford, Connecticut, this photo copier company adopted its present name in 1961

(1, 2).clue: Max Allan Collins wrote the novelization of this film starring Harrison Ford as President Marshall

(2, 2).clue: This British city's zoo in Regent's Park claims that its reptile house, opened in 1849, was the world's first

(3, 2).clue: Homes list for well over $1 million on this valuable "Vineyard" island of Massachusetts

(5, 2).clue: "I remember when rock was young" is the first line of this singer's hit "Crocodile Rock"

(6, 2).clue: It's the visionary technique used to create the image seen here

(1, 3).clue: Eric Stoltz is heard here reading A. Scott Berg's biography of this man

(2, 3).clue: The Henry Doorly Zoo in this Nebraska city boasts "The World's Largest Indoor Tropical Rainforest"

(4, 3).clue: Seen here, they were quite a pair

(5, 3).clue: This girl group gave us the '80s albums "Beauty and the Beat" & "Vacation"

(1, 4).clue: In 1997 Nathan Franks & Alan Bennett investigated the 1918 "Last Flight" of this German ace

(2, 4).clue: If you visit the Singapore Zoo, stay til late afternoon & have this British meal with an orangutan

(4, 4).clue: In the Bible, the first 2 brothers mentioned

(5, 4).clue: A member of this "Eye of the Tiger" group is suing CBS for trademark infringement

(1, 5).clue: Piers Paul Read's "Alive" is the true tale of a rugby team whose plane crashed in these South American mountains

(2, 5).clue: Dozens of Guinea baboons frolic on Baboon Island at the Brookfield Zoo in this Midwest state

(4, 5).clue: Songwriting team who gave us "The Sound of Music"

(5, 5).clue: This interracial soul group got "Everyday People" to "Dance to the Music"

(1, 1).clue: Custer's Last Stand is also known by the oxymoronic name "Little Big" this

(3, 1).clue: In 1990 the lights on the Strip were dimmed for 10 minutes to honor this late, great "Candy Man" performer

(4, 1).clue: Only a few living things, like some germs, can live without this gas symbolized O

(5, 1).clue: On January 13, 1999 this Chicago Bulls player retired after 13 seasons in which he averaged 31.5 points a game

(1, 2).clue: In the 1950s, if your button said, "I Like Ike", he was your man

(3, 2).clue: The girl in the Rat Pack, she later played a cranky former first lady in 1994's "Guarding Tess"

(5, 2).clue: In Nov. 2000 Phil Mickelson caught this tiger by the tail, winning the Tour Championship PGA Tournament

(6, 2).clue: For his role in "Cast Away", Tom Hanks won one of these awards in 2001

(1, 3).clue: Born in Tennessee, Davy Crockett died in what's now this state

(3, 3).clue: In a 1953 film Dean Martin sang this song heard here

(4, 3).clue: Though the Earth isn't a perfect sphere, its eastern & western halves are each called this

(5, 3).clue: In 1998 this Cardinal first baseman had a National League record 162 walks to go along with his 70 home runs

(6, 3).clue: Seen here, he was a U.S. presidential candidate in 1964

(1, 4).clue: William Cody's 2-word nickname, or perhaps what he sent out to his clients at the end of each month

(3, 4).clue: This Rat Packer played Joey Barnes on his self-titled '60s sitcom

(5, 5).clue: America's oldest regularly contested foot race, it's been held since 1897 when the length was 24.5 miles

(6, 5).clue: There are European & American varieties of this songbird, seen here

(0, 0).clue: In an interview, Jackie confided that JFK regularly fell asleep listening to the soundtrack of this Broadway play
